identificationModule.briefTitle: Brain Imaging Study of Brain Plasticity in Chronic Stroke Patients
identificationModule.officialTitle: Functional Magnetic Resonance Imaging and Diffusion Tensor Imaging Study About Reorganization and Recovery Mechanism of Brain Neural Network for Chronic Stroke Patients

descriptionModule.briefSummary: In chronic stroke patients, brain network reorganization and recovery mechanism are investigated after stroke onset using functional MRI and diffusion tensor imaging analyses.

armGroups.label: Chronic stroke
armGroups.description: More than 3 months post-stroke Ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke

interventions.name: Chronic stroke
interventions.description: MRI data acquisition and behavioral test

primaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation coefficient between strength of connection and the Fugl-Meyer Assessment score
primaryOutcomes.description: Strength of connection is obtained by calculating a correlation coefficient between time courses of both regions in fMRI data.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year

primaryOutcomes.measure: Correlation coefficient between the FA value of a tract and the Fugl-Meyer Assessment score
primaryOutcomes.description: FA value is obtained by assessing a diffusion anisotropy of a specific tract in DTI data.
primaryOutcomes.timeFrame: Through study completion, an average of 1 year

eligibilityModule.eligibilityCriteria:
Inclusion Criteria:

* more than 3 months post-stroke
* ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke
* a person who understands the experiment and has a willingness to participate and signs the agreement

Exclusion Criteria:

* User of artificial heartbeat
* Patients with claustrophobia
* Patients with metal implants
* Patients who are contraindicated for other common MRI
eligibilityModule.studyPopulation: A person who was inpatient at subacute stage at the Samsung Medical Center.
